events.description: The first ascent of Zugspitze was made by Josef Naus, a surveyor from the Bavarian State Survey Office.
A hut was built on the summit to serve as a weather station.
A cog railway was built to connect the town of Garmisch-Partenkirchen to the Zugspitze.
The first cable car was built, which reduced the travel time to the summit from hours to minutes.
A new weather station was built on the summit to replace the old hut.
The Eibsee Cable Car was built, providing an alternative route to the summit.
Zugspitze hosted some of the events of the Winter Olympics in Garmisch-Partenkirchen.
The Zugspitze Glacier was officially declared a nature reserve.
The Allies bombed the Zugspitze cable car, causing extensive damage.
The cable car was rebuilt and reopened to the public.
A new cog railway was built to replace the old one.
The Tyrolean Zugspitze Cable Car was built on the Austrian side of the mountain.
A new restaurant was built on the summit to replace the old one.
A new cable car was built on the German side of the mountain.
A new weather station was built on the summit to replace the old one.
The Gletscherbahn Zugspitze cable car was built on the German side of the mountain.
The Zugspitze Glacier was officially declared a protected area.
A new mountain hut was built on the summit to replace the old one.
The Zugspitze Railway was privatized.
The Tyrolean Zugspitze Cable Car was modernized.
The Zugspitzplatt ski area was expanded.
A new cable car was built on the Austrian side of the mountain.
A new cable car was built on the German side of the mountain.
A new summit restaurant was built on the summit to replace the old one.
The Zugspitzplatt ski area was expanded again.
The Tyrolean Zugspitze Cable Car was modernized again.
A new cable car was built on the German side of the mountain.
The Zugspitzplatt ski area was expanded once more.

The Tyrolean Zugspitze Cable Car was modernized.
